reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has definitely changed a lot over the past year.  Everything was originally just a deathmatch with no respawning.  Now it has mini-bases that you must destroy and claim as your own, which then strengthens your main base or something...  I don't know exactly how it works but the point is that if you find the new mode too complicated, you can still go back to the original deathmatch mode.  Everything you see and hear from the trailers above can give you an idea about how it works, with you building your own war machines and stuff, so I won't waste your time.  Really the only downside to this game is the long waiting times to get into a match recently now that so many people are on at once, but I'm sure that will be fixed soon enough.  Oh wait, I haven't said something funny yet.   Sarah Palin!  Now give me 10,000 likes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It is p2w grindfest.

Newest update changed system to something we have seen in Hearthstone. Now you receive random loot instead of money after a match. This pretty much meant you will spend most of your time grinding aimlessly for poor 25% Robits(It is equivalent to Hearthstone dust) rate to get parts you want. Any building is also now limited to one robot as you cannot use one part in multiple builds, I scrapped all my robots from pre-update to buy half of weapons for my main one. It wasn't big problem when your limiter was your level but now it is Hearthstone where you can only use your legendary card in only one deck.

On top of that now you can encounter people who got lucky and got much better legendary weapons in their crates, which pretty much makes this game p2w as you can get better than other players using money. Before you were matched against people with same level and all of you had same weapons, now inequality in equipment are absolutely huge.

On top of that there are still problems like rail guns being pretty much anti-fun.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is definitely a lot of fun. Think of Roblox. Now think of World of Tanks. Now think of Besiege. Combine all of those with some Call of Duty gamemodes, and you get Robocraft! Build your own tanks however you can imagine, then put them into the battlefield with other tanks to fight to the death! Physics are amazing in this game, as your tank actually falls apart as you loose health! The graphics are simply gorgeous, and the mechanics work very nicely. Good control scheme, all in all a great game. 8/10, would play again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having played alot and finally just reaching T10, it has been a great deal of fun, not without its challenging moments. But learning to adapt and change your robot design is what ive found to be most enjoyable, its not about throwing some wheels and weapons on some blocks going into battle, failing and raging. Take your time to think about your designs, build a fighting machine that is attuned to your own play style and tactics.

This game has suffered from becoming very popular very quickly, the devs have had to deal with rapid growth in player base, they have had to grow every aspect of their business, and with such growth there are bound to be issues. Personally i think they monetized with micro transactions to early, it has caused people who have paid to rage about balance issues, which are infact the norm for any game in development, but there is no going back now.(i understand fully they need money to grow, this could have been achieved in other ways).

Overall I do recommend this game, as it stands there is vast potential for unique designs of robot, not to mention the updates they have planned that will give us lots of new parts to use. Remember this is an early access game, it is changing and will continue to do so

Early Access Review

Until the last update I would have always recommend this game, interesting concept, good execution, enough players so matchmaking is quite pleasent.
Since the last updates though they're introducing a rather dubious anti cheat solution which takes a rather aggressive route and should not be supported in the slightest.
If you're an electronics engineer like me and have to run your system in testmode to support unsigned drivers it just won't let you start the game at all.
Their stance on this is rather narrow minded as well, closing forums threads trying to discuss this issue and the like.

All in all just stay away from this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun game until they make changes.  Awful management.  Simply awful.

1)  You create based on what you've tested and played thus far, then they pull the rug out from under your creation by making significant game-swaying changes seemingly without having done much testing/balancing of their own.  Any fun you have putting energy/thought/creativity/TIME into your robot is suddenly turned into twice as much frustration because they change the rules of the world/game upon which you based your creation.

2)  Team matching" is entirely random or non-existent.  Rare is the match where the teams are even.  One game you dominate and feel like king of the world only to be slapped senseless in your next match.  How about checking some numbers before throwing together two teams?

3)  Pretty sure they have no idea what to do with mega-robots.  All these cool huge scale robot late-game items that you figure out after-the-fact can't be used like the robots you played with up to that point.  Can't participate in some game modes and can't use most of the other robot-building parts with the "mega" items.

Don't waste your money or time - I've wasted enough for both of us.

"

I'm no pro critic but this is what I think of it,

For starters you got your average building game with crafts. It's good and all but you want more parts? Level up!

OR if you're a rich person who likes to throw away money and waste the game, Pay for premium!

With Premium you get to instantly play the game and fund for the devs to keep making it worse!
And what's more better than that!?

Now for actual game it's good but it's utterly ruined by the massive pay to win!" Aspect.

Why am I paying to keep up and get better. Why do people get to do this.
And why isn't premium forever?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here's a basic summary of why everyone, including myself, can't recommend this game.

The game used to have a lot of depth and rquired stategy to succeed at it. You had a pilot seat which was the critical block to defend, rewarding good robot designs which defended this weak point. Your robot was limited to a single type of gun, prompting robots to perform specific roles and fill specific niches, encouraging teamwork. There wasn't auto regenerating health, requiring you to fight strategically and making medics meaningful.

Now, you charge into the enemy with wild abandon, doing as much damage as you can in order to score points. Then, when you're low on health, you take cover for 15 seconds and recover to full health. There is no higher strategy. You do as much damage as you can as fast as you can. If you aren't doing damage, the point system won't reward you, and you'll drop in ranking. But most aggregious of all, even if you win, if you're not in the top half of the score board, you'll drop rank. So even if you're fulfilling an intergral role to the team that leads to their victor, if you aren't doing something the point system recognizes, you will be penalized and lose rank.

This game puts the cart before the horse, prioritizing monetization over fun and getting rid of depth in order to make the game more accessible to a wider market. However, most insulting of all is the Devs' attitude. They simply ignore any feedback from the forums, leaving their mods to silence anyone who steps out of line.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played this game for over a year and about 600 hours (the standalone launcher isn't tracked by Steam) and spent probably $50 altogether on premium time and cosmetic items.

Robocraft used to be good, but then the lead devs started coming to work with their pants on their heads. The Epic Loot update made it virtually impossible to get the robot parts you need to finish your robot, as everything is based on random drops. The game is still plagued by game-breaking bugs (like half the players on a team never connecting) that have been around for over a year.

The devs are pretending that nothing's wrong, even though they are hemorrhaging players on a daily basis.

Don't waste your time here. It's another grindy, pay-to-win cashgrab disguised as a freemium game.
voteText: 12 of 12 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe most important thing to know for someone looking to maybe get into this game is that it is in Early Access and despite being in this state for quite some time the developers seem to have lost their vision and moved away from their original Design and Fight" game model to one more conducive to micro-transaction monitization. If you are familiar with the many pay-to-win smartphone games out there
date: you will find the current Robocraft very familiar.\n\nOne big down side of this change is that it cripples the original vision of being able to design creative vehicles. The nature of the random loot rewards means you either have to pay (real money) for large amounts of crates ($100 in crates would be a reasonable initial invenstment) so you can get enough of the same type of parts to even have a hope of designing what you want
recommended: or you plan on grinding for months with whatever cobbled together frankenstein of a bot you can manage.\n\nThis isn't to say you cannot sell the unwanted parts for in-game currency to buy the parts you want. The problem is the exchange rate is very
hoursPlayed: very bad with respect to the cost of the parts (10% - 30%). In addition
voteText: the random nature of the drops makes it undesireable to exchange any parts
helpfulPercent: since you never know when you will need one of them to make a design you just thought up ... or more realistically collect enough matching parts to make a complete bot
votesHelpful: ignoring if you wanted to play that type of bot in the first place.\n\nFor example: movement types are collected one at a time
votesTotal: and you usually need at least 4 to be stable. So you would need to sell 4-5 random movement parts to buy just one of the type you actually wanted. On the other hand
votesFunny: if you kept those movement parts you would be partially along in 2-3 other movment types that you might want to try out later. So you have the choice of sacrificing being able to make multiple bots later for progress on making one bot now. The same goes for weapons
commentsCount: you could sell multiple weapons to buy a single weapon you wanted
column16: but since you need 4-10 weapons per bot you really sacrifice your future ability to create bots if you do that.\n\nIn conclusion
column17: the game had a lot of initial promise which seems to have been lost in the developers desire to turn it into a pay-to-win smartphone style game. My recommendation is to skip the Early Access stage of this game and wait for the final release of the game to see what the developers actually end up delivering."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played for 2 years, around 550+ hours, enjoyed it the first years when it was pretty balanced, from beginning to end.

Now ? Now I would tell you to just look for a better game for you to play for free.

The opened doors that shouldn't be open in their updates, everyone and everything can use any gun. That means that you can use the most overpowered gun that what thought it should be used for lategame into earlygame thanks to their so RNG boxes and crafting sistem. Not to mention that you will get 1/10 of the price of the items you get from boxes with their awful recycle sistem.

There are RNGboxes that you can buy with money, and what comes, comes random, and that you could grind with time by winning boxes as you play. So you can either pay 100$ at start with 300 boxes of pure randomness, which can be painful since there is no skip button, and that if you don't have premium, you gain HALF what you get, so get that in mind, cuz premium for 6 months is 40 euros for me, maybe its another 50$ so in total is 150$

Their ranked sistem is broken since 1st day... You are bronze at first, fighting against diamonds, Leveling up will be tedious as ♥♥♥♥, for you will be wanting to be AFK

The punishment to leave a game is 2 mins... Same goes for Ranked, 2 mins punishment if you leave. You will be also leaving since it will be a 6 vs 8 all the time.  Because wasting 10 mins for the enemy to destroy you when you can leave and wait 2 mins to start another and get a better reward is way efficient that wasting time.

You can still aim with some weapons, but their is one weapon that you will be screaming of how the hell hide from it. Lock-on luncher missle. What you would thought that only tanks could carry such big weapon, helicopters and planes can fly above any cover for you to escape and destroy you over and over again.

Until they Fix their balance with weapons weight and damage, or just go back to the old days that you will have to pick just 1 weapon for a bot, they I just can recomend this game to any.

It went to a nice 8/10 to a 2/10. Awful game now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I got this game when it first came out and i thought it was good for a couple updates, then it went down hill.FAST.
I quit playing this for 1 1/2 years due to the non-helpful/game inproving updates.

I tried it again today (May 23 2015) found out it got worse. it went from a free to play/somewhat equal with the option to play to might as well pay to today where the only way i can see how you can really improve anymore is pay.(to get any good wepons you have to pay) Everything is overhauled. The currency, the object naming system(Its now remenicent of Steiger Tractor co. only more confusing) and now(Good or Bad) The announcer(s?) sound almost exactly like TF2. Dont drag them into this mess and run from this game.

In all if you could get a version from ~1 year ago get it. This version NO.

Edit: I do see steam does say this game is mostly negative" with in the last 30 days
recommended: im surprised there isnt a overall "negative" rating"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played for 2 years, around 550+ hours, enjoyed it the first years when it was pretty balanced, from beginning to end.

Now ? Now I would tell you to just look for a better game for you to play for free.

The opened doors that shouldn't be open in their updates, everyone and everything can use any gun. That means that you can use the most overpowered gun that what thought it should be used for lategame into earlygame thanks to their so RNG boxes and crafting sistem. Not to mention that you will get 1/10 of the price of the items you get from boxes with their awful recycle sistem.

There are RNGboxes that you can buy with money, and what comes, comes random, and that you could grind with time by winning boxes as you play. So you can either pay 100$ at start with 300 boxes of pure randomness, which can be painful since there is no skip button, and that if you don't have premium, you gain HALF what you get, so get that in mind, cuz premium for 6 months is 40 euros for me, maybe its another 50$ so in total is 150$

Their ranked sistem is broken since 1st day... You are bronze at first, fighting against diamonds, Leveling up will be tedious as ♥♥♥♥, for you will be wanting to be AFK

The punishment to leave a game is 2 mins... Same goes for Ranked, 2 mins punishment if you leave. You will be also leaving since it will be a 6 vs 8 all the time.  Because wasting 10 mins for the enemy to destroy you when you can leave and wait 2 mins to start another and get a better reward is way efficient that wasting time.

You can still aim with some weapons, but their is one weapon that you will be screaming of how the hell hide from it. Lock-on luncher missle. What you would thought that only tanks could carry such big weapon, helicopters and planes can fly above any cover for you to escape and destroy you over and over again.

Until they Fix their balance with weapons weight and damage, or just go back to the old days that you will have to pick just 1 weapon for a bot, they I just can recomend this game to any.

It went to a nice 8/10 to a 2/10. Awful game now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a great game... or at least it was. I have been playing this game for a long time since the very early days and it has given me almost 150 hours of fun. Unfortunately the latest update has turned the game into a completely joyless chore.

I dont know what the developers were thinking but now the only rewards you get for doing well in matches are crates full of random junk which you then can turn around and recycle for 1/4 of what it costs you to  build that item.  90% of the crates have nothing of any real value in them and the recycler gives you so little in return that it hardly feels worth it to recycle the valuable items you get just because you don't need them right this second. FreeJam.... this is not the proper way to retain your players.

These kind of games are sort of like a job. You do the work, you get paid, you spend that pay on new blocks or items and you progress slowly.  Imagine your employer decides to change the way you get paid. Instead of giving you a paycheck, he or she gives you a crate full of random items that vary in value from day to day. Once a month you get lucky but most days you end up working all day for a box containing a snowglobe, a rusty nail, 3 candles and an empty can of spray paint.... That would kind of ♥♥♥♥ you off wouldn't it?

If this gets changed then I absolutely reccomend this game. With it the way it is now... steer way clear of robocraft

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

等级分配没有逻辑，武器平衡极度不平衡，载具分配队伍极度混乱。
地图设计狭隘，过小，过于固化
，商店系统极度疯狂，以前是半价出售，现在是10-20%出售。
抽取箱子获得物品再卖根本不能买什么东西，而且抽取箱子根本没有范围，顶级箱子能开出一堆垃圾，最差的箱子能开出一个神器。
履带，车轮，特别是固定翼根本没有多少发挥威力的地方。
游戏模式过于单一。人机根本不能打出来什么东西，以前打十个ai能买一对轮子，现在想买一个轮子都难
个人不建议新玩家来玩。

There is no logic in the level distribution, the weapons balance is extremely uneven, and the distribution team is extremely confusing.
Map design is narrow, too small, too solidified
, the store system is extremely crazy, before the sale is half price, and now it is 10-20% for sale.
Extraction box for items to sell simply can not buy anything, and extraction box no range, top box can open a heap of rubbish, the worst case can open an artifact.
The track, the wheel, and the fixed wing, in particular, have no place to exert its power.
Game mode is too single. Man machine can not hit anything, before playing ten AI can buy a pair of wheels, and now want to buy a wheel is difficult
Individuals do not recommend new players to play.

I am writing it used to" because the developer decided to promote their premium stronger and thus changed the economy model to a random drop system. This at the begining might be fun but soon you notice that you can't just buy the stuff you need to build your robot. You would have to recycle your previous rewards in order to get a fraction of their wealth back as robits

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Came back after a few month long break. My megas witch i worked so long to get, gone, all the mega modules sell at 1/3 or 1/4 the price i bought them at. All my t10 armor cubes, are just normal trash white ones, no refunds or anything for the fact that my hoard of t10 and TX cubes went down to default crappy ones. Colors for only premium users, tech point system completely scrapped, and of course another crappy money mooch crate system to replace it, yeah let me spend money so i don't get cubes in my crate, and get a wheel.

Good job devs, you had a great game, all you had to do was add more game modes/weapons/content/parts/propulsion systems and instead you decided to spit all over it just so you can mooch some more money off people.

Iv been playing Robocraft on and off since its first public release, and this is the worst it has ever been, and the future looks even bleaker.

Just don't bother, there are better games out there.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ever wondered what moving to another country and then finally returning back to your former country only to find it a burning cesspit feels like? because I sure do.

This game is a mere shell of it's former self, it used to be great, it was simple, it was fun. Then the devs decided to destroy the aspect of creativity, make billions of new types of weapons that nobody asked for, (and are completely overpowered) and make it a complete pay to win cash grab. Guess how that went.

99% of the positive reviews are from when the game was actually enjoyable. Also, if you're thinking well at least they didn't screw up the ranking system" They did that too. They removed megabots which completely destroyed the idea of working towards the goal of creating a huge robot.

"Could this get any worse?" a veteran robocraft player would say
recommended: it does. instead of having a tech tree where you gradually earn new parts as you level up you now have a crate system where you have to spend REAL money to get a random part.\n\nIf Robocraft would go back to what it was before
hoursPlayed: I would play it again. But that will never happen. If you have any self respect

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is super fun. You have a plethora or blocks, guns, wheels, turbines, etc to build your own robot any way you like.

I just noticed there was an update (that plane looks awesome, going to install again and check it out!)

The only bad part so far is the limited maps. Seems to be about 2 different kinds of levels (desert and snow) with I think 2-4 differnt maps for each - gets boring fast.

Also, one bad thing is that people will abuse the higher level guns and build a minimalist vehicle with one higher power gun and just sit back and wreck everyone, so that gets a bit frustrating.

Highly relies on team work.

Would recommend. This game can only get better, and it's free!

Edit: After making it to tier 10 after 100 hours in the game, it's pretty much lost it's fun.

I am level 54 or so, so my CPU is limited to 1015. There are people with lvl 100 in tier 10, which can have much more stuff on their robot, which is a huge advantage.

I am no longer interested in the game as it's only going to be repetetive from here on out. I will just get recked by higher level players and I'm not going to put myself through that.

Goodbye, robo craft, it was fun while it lasted.

Second edit:

They added mega bots. Every T10 match has one, on each team. Everyone just sticks with them now. No fun at all.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Came back from a long hiatus and the game design has changed so drastically that I no longer endorse this game. They had the perfect formula for progression and building strategy, but now it's nowhere near the tier it used to be on.

(TL;DR alert) I've decided to update my review a little further to elaborate on why I don't play anymore. I used to enjoy logging in to play a few casual matches, get some tokens, and have a feeling of progression - but it's kind of lost on me now. The removal of tech tokens changed the 'skill tree' like aspect of natural progression, but the actual gameplay itself is what killed my love for the game.

Originally, the pilot seat was the 'vip' so to say when you were designing a machine. All of the other blocks had to be skillfully placed to prevent the source block under the seat from being destroyed, and also from becoming detached from the rest of the blocks (if a single block connecting a mass of blocks to the pilot seat was destroyed, the mass of blocks was destroyed too). Exploiting this in matches was the most rewarding thing in the game - some robots could withstand volleys of fire with only cosmetic damage, but there were also those with obvious weak spots. Shooting said weak spots and watching 75% of their machine disappear was the highlight of playing a rail gun, or any other weapon for that matter. It was the highlight of the game. The second most rewarding part of this was playing the executioner afterwards; you drive along looking for the remnants of their bot (usually a wheel or two and a pilot seat) to deliver the final blow.

How did this change? The removal of pilot seats and the addition of an 'auto heal' mechanic for downed robots. This absolutely DESTROYED the enjoyment of the game for me. I regularly ended matches with my gunbed functioning at below 15% health, and this was due to having 3 working wheels and a gun left as a result of proper building around the mechanics of how damage was done. Not having any healing reinforced the importance of actually building properly and also the importance for players to have medic bots. The poorly built plasma bombers can no longer be punished - a shot to the weak spot will not destroy 75% of their robot, and in the off chance you ground them they will just automatically heal back up and continue flying.

Completely ignoring the pay to win mechanics and other atrocities that have come in to the game as well, the gameplay itself is sufficient to never play this game again. It used to reward building skill, strategy, and accuracy but now it mostly reinforces mediocrity. I got destroyed all the time when I first started playing, but I did research and learned how to make good machines which eventually allowed me to make variations that would give me usually about 6 kills per game (no respawns when I played)

I honestly don't even mind freemium models much, but I HATE when devs destroy a game which perfectly filled it's own niche. RIP Robocraft.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I used to love this game.... About a year a go I posted a review saying it was incredibly good... Yet the developers of this game have ruined it. They've completly savaged the original concept and destroyed the game I used to love. A few months back they released an update which added that new gamemode with the horrible Voice Actor and I stopped playing quickly after that... A few days ago I came back to it and found it butchered even more to the point where my car which when I was playing it was one of the most powerful designs I had built and was a Tier 9... Now I come back to find the speedy car a slow tank with no damage or health and its no longer T9... it's 11M?! WTF is 11m?! The game has just become terrible without the tier system and I do not want any one who played the original GOOD version of this game to go near it... It's trash.

Oh and it is buggy as all hell! I constantly get errors when moving between the confusing UI to try and get to battle or build... Naming the garage option Drive" is just stupid. The key binds don't even work for me and most of the newer stuff is pointless... The renting a robot system is pointless as anyone could just copy the design block by block for less money.

2/10 You let me down devs. ~ DoubleIka 2015
Also having the show mouse bound to RIGHT CTRL by default is a really dumb thing and just awkward to use"

My armor blob also was now way more useless. Previously it made sense to take damage over a longer time. Not this is complitly discurraged because the auto healing only favors players that always hide and play "whack a mole" tactics.

All the folowing "updates" just put the nail in the koffin. Its such a terrible cash grab by triend to make the game casual and "pay to play like you want" that I don't even want to think about it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've spent around 1,200 hours on this game (I have accounts that do not go through Steam). 1,200 hours is a very long time. I remember each platoon I was in. I made so many friends over the last year on this game, but after each update, some of my friends would leave out of boredom or not agreeing with the Devs. I was always sad when they left, but since I still liked the game I would stay and make new friends.

Fast forward to the Maximum Loadout update. I thought the game was at its best. You could make whatever you wanted, a giant helicopter that could both damage or heal, a frontline tank that could take more damage than anyone else, or even a stealth bomber to sneak behind the other team. No matter what you were, you felt useful to the team and could fill multiples roles for your team.

I was having so much fun with my platoon, expirimenting with different loadouts and trying random builds and seeing how they worked. I could spend hours building an amazing robot and then use it in battle, perfect its flaws, and do whatever I wanted.

It was around that update when I reach Protonium 5, the highest league rank in the game. Admitidly, after playing for so long, I was getting bored with the game. I could at least enjoy playing the game with my high quality robots and my friends. (Probably 800 of those hours were with the same platoons, the same friends).

And now, with this latest update, I find that I am the platoon member who is leaving. I am the friend that disagrees with the Devs. I can't help but feel bad about leaving my friends, but the game isnt what it used to be. I can't enjoy it. You could spend hours making something to have it beaten by 10 blocks with a hover and a flak cannon. There isn't any joy left in the game.

I loved how the game used to be, like a boyhood dream of building with legos then fighting with them, but now its like my dad (Freejam), who owns the legos (my robots), just crushed all of my creations and the time I put into them.

If the game was like it was before, I would overwhelmingly recomend it, but as of its current state, do yourself a favor and don't play it.

R.I.P. Robocraft

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game used to be a lot of fun when it first came out. Ever since the megabot update, things have been going downhill. I've tried taking a new look with an open mind and always come to the same conclusion. PAY TO WIN. They cut out a lot of the fun features in the game and added more and more things you can do with the premium currency. The costs of the items make playing without premium time a grind that lasts days for a single part at tier X or higher, and even with premium time, if you want to build a real megabot, you basically have to farm for weeks or throw massive amounts of money at the game. I think the devs need to admit they made a mistake and rollback these new patches and give us the game we fell in love with back.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Can you imagine a ball going down from the top of a hill? Right, it not only goes down but also does it faster and faster!

Why I said you to imagine such a thing? Well, that's simple. This ball is Robocraft and a hill is its quality. You can easily see that I've spend quite a bit of time in it. Robocraft had nice balance, matchmaking, freedom for creativity and so on. Now... Now newbies are getting rekt by players with just one giant overpowered cannon...

Other negative side - developers. People were asking to add some things that would not worthen the game but make it more variative. Developers kept listening to cries of people who simply can't play well. That's how we lost a nice balancing. Some previous update destroyed everything we loved and when players start telling them about their mistakes what developers do? Yes! They make a new update with a new gun/module/other crap to shut peoples mouthes up for a while and when players are about to start complaining they make another one of such updates!

It can be said more but I don't want to burn down my chair... ;D

I deleted my review from 2 years. It was positive. Now I am writing a new review with the recent changes. This will be a huge stinkin' negative review.

They simply turned this into a gambling game. If you want to buy your own pieces of equipment get ready for the grind of your life. You have no control over what items you get now and the loot crates mostly give commons/uncommons.

When before you could get the epic" and "legendary" items quite easily and you got a good amount of credit if you did well in a battle. Throw all that out the window. Now it's a no guarantee to get anything you want unless you are ready to play hundreds

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am absolutely sad about the newest update... okay some older updates where bad too, but nothing has changed the whole game like the last.

It now feels like a smartphone game where you have to wait hours to play along or pay for some diamonds to progress better and faster.

The game is now only enjoyable if you already had a huge pile of items and money before the implemented the update.
To get a full set of higher tiered weapons you have to play about 1000hrs(someone did the math) because you dont get any money after the battle, but just a cate with random items(good luck getting good or even wanted ones).

If you get some higher priced items in your crate and think you can recycle them - nope you only get a tiny fraction of the value wich you would have to pay for it normally.

As a new player you get some items and ready bots at the beginning already, but if you drive them into battle you will face massive powerfull bots with the best possible weapons and you will have no chance to conquer them.

I played this game about 1500hrs, but now I see it incredibly fast dying.

The concept and the possibilitys are still great and I really hope they introduce a steady income again... but yeah RIP

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Unfortunately Robocraft is a grinding game right now. You wont be able to progress for weeks, if you don't know how to build a good robot or if you don't have enough material from earlier versions of the game to buy shotguns, the currently most powerful weapon.

I cannot recommend this game for people who want to play alone or rage easily.
Inspite of the clearly bad mechanism behind the game right now, it may still be interesting for those who like to experiment with bot designs and be creative( to an extent).

But except for that bit of creativity (which will only make you understand that you designs suck) and the kick of adrenalin, there is not much to get from this game.

Most players are not interested in making friends anyway.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game used to be incredible. It was a free to play game that wasn't pay to win, and for the developers innovation, the game won indie game of the year. But then, for some reason, they stopped listening to their players, and update by update completely changed the fantastic game they had to a pay to win, unbalanced mess. With each update, the game gets worse and with each update, the servers become more desolate. I do not recomend this game as it was once unique and great, but now blends in with the sea of other failed free to play" games. If you join now
date: you are joining a dwindling playerbase in a terrible game that will soon
hoursPlayed: be completely barren
voteText: where empty servers are simply a monument to what was years ago."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\njust quoting another review i totaly agree with. Stay away from this game. Simply put
date: the development team (FreeJam) is utterly incompetent. There have been so many points in time where the game could have become significantly better with a few minor changes here and there (primarily related to rebalancing weapons/components or various quality of life changes). Instead
recommended: FreeJam ignores those high-impact low-hanging fruit
hoursPlayed: and instead decides to flip the entire game on its head and release major updates that change everything in a big way. This accomplishes nothing other than introducing a multitude of new problems
voteText: while rarely addressing those issues that could have been easily fixed. Sure
helpfulPercent: during the course of the coming weeks and months
votesHelpful: FreeJam will slowly but surely resolve some of the screw-ups they made during their last update
votesTotal: until the game once again gets to that point where it could be great with just a few small changes...but then the cycle repeats itself and as expected
votesFunny:
just on the horizon is another game breaking update.

Other major issues with the game:

1) Building/engineering used to be a major component of the game
commentsCount: and high level players used to take pride in their building skills. Nowadays
column16: building skill is hardly worth anything anymore. Any new player can slap something together in 5 minutes and compete toe-to-toe against a bot that took hours to complete. In fact
column17: don't even bother building anything
column18: because within weeks
column19: FreeJam will render your bot utterly useless by breaking it. Either they'll nerf your movement or make various components 10 times heavier
column20: etc. Regardless of how they break it
column21: just be ready to say goodbye to your favorite bots
column22: as they won't be able to perform nearly as well as they once did "because FreeJam said so."\n\n2) Significant weapon imbalances and easy-mode weapons. Simply put
column23: FreeJam rarely gets weapon balance 100% right
column24: or even close to it. In the current state of the game
column25: there are weapons that are grossly overpowered
column26: and there are weapons that are grossly underpowered. There are also weapons that take little to no skill to use
column27: and yet have been high-impact weapons previously (a new patch attempted to address some of these issues
column28: but the jury is still out).\n\n3) FreeJam doesn't care about players who have been around for years
column29: players with thousands of hours in the game
column30: players who have been active and have helped spread the word about the game. They won't listen to your feedback
column31: no matter how good it is or how well-written it is. Instead
column32: FreeJam does its own thing
column33: with a bias towards catering to new players. Basic things that the competitive/veteran community has been requesting for years...still not here. Things like clans have been "on FreeJam's radar" since mid-2014 or earlier - and guess what? Still not implemented
column34: and it is almost mid-2016. The sad part is
column35: by the time FreeJam actually decides to implement clans
column36: all of the top clans in the game will be dead
column37: as all of their veteran members will find better things to do with their time than to play this.\n\n4) Minimal skill required. If you were looking for a game where putting in tons of hours would give you a significant skill advantage over new players
column38: please look elsewhere. FreeJam has stated that they want the game to be more accessible to new players. This might be good for new players
column39: but for anyone who has invested a significant amount of time into the game
column40: it is just a slap in the face.\n\nFreeJam: One step forward
column41: two steps back. Always.""

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Score: 2/10
Date: (5/16/16) Update: Epic Loot

The newest update Epic Loot" has effectivly put a nail in the coffin for an otherwise great game.

Pros:
- Graphics are passable
- Gameplay is conditionally good if you have high level rails from before the epic loot update.

Cons:
- Pay to win
- Pay astronimical amount to win.
- After paying an astronomical amount you will still need to randomly get rails in crates
date: or legendary IONs to compete with players who bought them in the previous update.\n- Cirtain weapons are pretty much pointless
hoursPlayed: smgs
voteText:
tesla and plasma all fall short of rails.
- A single high teir mech leg with an ion on it garentees you a win.
- Matchmaker regularly puts your 300 point bot with 1500 point bots if you do well and will do it more often now as players leave.
- The price of premium is 30$ a month if you buy it a day at a time like I used to and it doesn't give you anything really.
- Sometimes your rails if you do have them randomly do not fire.
- Often being the best player on your team will net you an inferior crate just because you happen to be on the losing team.
- Random disconects will boot you off and them make you wait to get in a match considering you the same as a character that quit.
- Freejam says everything is fine
